value.title: Find a Text Term in a Field in Power BI Using DAX Functions
value.excerpt: In Power BI, there are multiple ways of searching for a text term inside a text field, you can use Power Query for doing this operation or calculations in DAX. In this video, I'll explain some functions in DAX that you can use to do this calculation. Most of these functions can be used inside a measure
value.featuredContent: <iframe width="800" height="500" frameborder="0" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/pPJwIzPck1U" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe>

value.title: Parsing Organizational Hierarchy or Chart of Accounts in Power BI with Parent child functions in DAX

value.title: Power BI Date or Calendar Table Best Method   DAX or Power Query
value.excerpt: So you want to create a date or calendar table in Power BI, and you search for ways to do that. Then you will find many different approaches for that. Some of the approaches are using Power Query, some are using DAX. Which method is the best? What is the actual difference between a date table created

value.title: Relationship Based on Multiple Fields in Power BI Using TREATAS DAX Function
value.excerpt: TreatAs is helpful for filtering, and it doesn't filter only based on one column, it can filter based on as many as columns you want. One of the challenges in Power BI relationships is creating a relationship based on multiple fields, I have previously explained a method you can use to create a compound
value.featuredContent: <iframe width="800" height="500" frameborder="0" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/_DuGkki0rfs" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe>

value.title: Showing Ranking in a Visual in Power BI using RANKX DAX function
value.excerpt: If you want to show the ranking in a Power BI visual, one way is to use a visual that supports that, such as a Ribbon chart. Another way, which is a more common way, is to write a calculation for rank, and RANKX is a DAX function that can help you with that. In this article and video, I explain how that
value.featuredContent: <iframe width="800" height="500" frameborder="0" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/FCWVX8W1QZk" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe>

value.title: Substring in DAX   How to get Part of String Field in Power BI Using DAX Expression
value.excerpt: Substring is one of the most common functions in many languages, However, there is no such function in DAX. There is a very simple way of doing it, which I am going to explain in this post. Substring means getting part of a string, for example from "Reza Rad", if I want to get the start starting from
value.featuredContent: <iframe width="800" height="500" frameborder="0" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/WEelCk04dYw" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe>

value.title: SUM vs SUMX What is the Difference of the two DAX Functions in Power BI
value.excerpt: Sum and Sumx are functions that often founded to be misleading for many Power BI users. As both functions are doing the aggregation, it seems a bit confusing what is the actual difference between these two. There are many blog posts and articles about each function. I always explain the difference with

value.title: TOPN DAX Function   How it works in Power BI   Comparison against the top group
value.excerpt: TOPN is a function in DAX that gives you the ability to select the top items from a table based on an expression. In this article and video, Iâ€™ll explain how to use the TopN function in DAX either to create a calculated table or to use it in a measure to achieve analysis such as; comparison with the

value.title: Writing calculations on a real time streaming Power BI dataset using DAX measures
value.excerpt: In the previous article and video, I explained a method that you can use to have real-time calculations in a Power BI streaming dataset. The calculations done that way are limited though because it is using the Q&A feature of Power BI. If you are after a complex calculation then DAX can definitely help.

value.title: Apply AND Logic to Multiple Selection in DAX Slicer
value.excerpt: When you apply a multiple selection to a slicer or to a filter, you obtain a logical OR condition between selected items. This video shows how to implement a logical AND condition in a measure instead of the standard OR one. Article and download: https://sql.bi/26121?aff=yt  How to learn DAX: https://www.sqlbi.com/guides/dax/?aff=yt
value.featuredContent: <iframe width="800" height="500" frameborder="0" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/tONOosN1xAs" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe>

value.title: Comparing with previous selected time period in DAX

value.title: Counting working days in DAX
value.excerpt: This video describes a DAX technique to compute the number of working days between two dates. Article and download: https://sql.bi/80301

value.title: Filtering a measure in DAX Studio
value.excerpt: DAX Studio can evaluate one or more measures in a query. Marco Russo shows how to apply filters to a measure executed in DAX Studio. Continuous learning to improve your productivity!  How to learn DAX: https://www.sqlbi.com/guides/dax/ DAX Studio: https://daxstudio.org/

value.title: How to debug a DAX measure
value.excerpt: Use DAX Studio to run and debug a DAX measure: fix a calculation issue in a more productive environment and then copy the right formula back in Power BI. How to learn DAX: https://www.sqlbi.com/guides/dax/ DAX Studio: https://daxstudio.org/ VertiPaq Analyzer: https://www.sqlbi.com/tools/vertipaq-analyzer/

value.title: Using OR conditions between slicers in DAX
value.excerpt: How to implement a logical OR condition between two slicers of a Power BI report, or of a PivotTable in Excel. By default, when relying on more than one slicer they are considered in an AND condition. This video+article explains how to change this behavior using DAX.  Article and sample download: https://sql.bi/66373?aff=yt

value.title: Build a P&L in Power BI Without Any DAX
value.excerpt: This is the third article where I have covered building a P&L in Power BI. My first 2 articles here and here focused on how to use the DAX language to solve some of the common problems with P&L reporting, such as adding sub totals into the visual, % of [...]Read More Â»

value.title: When to use Power Query/M vs Data Modelling/DAX
value.excerpt: Ken Puls and I decided we would do a live stream chat to talk about a topic of interest to Power BI people.Â  We put out a survey and 75% of the respondents wanted to hear about “when to use Power Query/M vs Data Modelling/DAX”.Â  It’s a really interesting topic [...]Read More Â»
